definition: round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)

sentences.english: Among the vast numbers of Party and League members the activists and middle elements are rising to give battle .
sentences.chinese: 廣大黨團員中的積極分子及中間羣衆起而對抗。

sentences.english: The western Pacific island of Guam held Democratic Party caucuses on Saturday.
sentences.chinese: 西太平洋上的關島在星期六舉行了民主黨黨團大會。

sentences.english: Members of the Communist party should serve as role models to others.
sentences.chinese: 廣大黨團員要發揮好模範帶頭作用。

sentences.english: The People's Party group, as the largest political group in the European Parliament, is duty-bound in every means.
sentences.chinese: 人民黨黨團作爲歐洲議會第一大黨團更是責無旁貸。

sentences.english: The People's Party group, as the largest political group in the European Parliament, is duty-bound in every means.
sentences.chinese: 人民黨黨團作爲歐洲議會第一大黨團更是責無旁貸。

definition: Chen Shui-Bian (1950-), Taiwanese DPP 民進黨|民进党 politician, president of the Republic of China 2000-2008
within the party (esp. Chinese communist party)
William Lai Ching-te (1959-), Taiwanese DPP politician, vice president of the Republic of China from 2020
Ma Ying-jeou (1950-), Taiwanese Kuomintang politician, Mayor of Taipei 1998-2006, president of Republic of China 2008-2016
Green Standard Army, standing infantry during Qing dynasty, originally formed from Ming and other Chinese army units
the state of play in an election/the current state of a candidate's campaign
Lee Teng-hui (1923-2020), Taiwanese politician, president of ROC 1988-2000
Taiwan independence/(of Taiwan) to declare independence
